tweet: Proud to join my colleagues to pass #HR1112 which would enforce a new process that allows the FBI more time to conduct a thorough background check on firearm purchases, extending the hurried 3-day period to a 10-day investigation. Another commonsense Bill to combat gun violence.

Yesterday the House passed #HR8 which would require universal background checks on all potential gun sales so individuals who are a danger to themselves and others are no longer able to purchase a gun. This is the first major legislation passed to address gun control since 1994.
Tune in to CNN Prime Time with @ChrisCuomo to hear me discuss Michael Cohen’s testimony in the Oversight Committee today.

Local leaders, like Mayor Martin Walsh of Boston and Mayor Tom Koch of Quincy have been vigilant in urging sustainable solutions to protect coastal communities from the effects of climate change. #ActOnClimate

No President should be allowed to subvert the Constitutional authority granted to the elected Representatives of the people. With 227 cosponsors, Joint Resolution 46 must first pass the House and then will be voted on in the Senate.

Proud to join my colleagues as a cosponsor of the H.J. Resolution 46 to prevent the President from removing funding from existing programs for National Defense that were authorized by Congress and he already approved.

Massachusetts lost over 1,500 lives to opioids last year, a tragic epidemic that has swept the entire Nation. I am pleased to report the Funding Bill that we passed tonight includes $347M for local grant programs to help address the opioid crisis.

H.R. 1201 would also require federal agencies to develop corresponding plans to address the impact of climate change on their national security missions and to update these plans at least annually. https://www.congress.gov/bill/116th-congress/house-bill/1201/text?r=1&s=1 …
The Climate Change National Security Strategy Act would ensure our government actively prepares for the impacts of climate change in the development of relevant national security policies.

Climate change must become a bipartisan national security priority now. Rapidly rising sea levels threaten our power grid, our water systems and vital infrastructure. That is why I introduced my Bill, the Climate Change National Security Strategy Act, H.R. 1201.

Last month I signed on as a cosponsor of #HR8, the Bipartisan Background Checks Act of 2019. This is a first step to combat gun violence, which killed nearly 40,000 Americans last year. Requiring background checks on all firearm sales is a commonsense law we must implement now.

I’m proud that my Democratic colleagues kept fighting and refused to surrender to someone who showed such blatant disrespect for America’s workers. pic.twitter.com/5rk0fL6Bbk

It was the President’s reckless and irresponsible decision to shut the government down and use federal workers as hostages, forcing air traffic controllers and TSA employees to work without pay. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7MSfhdtjg_c …

The lapse in federal funding burdened our overworked, unpaid FAA employees and disrupted safety-related work. H.R. 1108 will ensure that doesn’t happen again by providing funding from the Airport and Airway Trust Fund for all FAA activities in the event of a government shutdown.

Today the Subcommittee on Aviation held our first hearing about the impacts of President Trump’s shutdown on U.S. Aviation where I spoke in strong support of H.R. 1108, which would allow the airline industry to operate during government shutdowns. @TransportDems

Guns with a magazine that can hold more than 10 rounds of ammunition have been used in some of the most horrific mass shootings in American history. Congress must act now and pass these modest, common sense laws so this history does not repeat itself. @RepTedDeutch

Today my colleagues and I took legislative action to address the spate of mass shootings in America and introduced the Keep Americans Safe Act. This Bill would prohibit the transfer, importation and possession of magazines able to hold more than 10 rounds of ammunition.

More than 100 million people, or 83% of American workers, do not have paid family leave through their jobs and we must ensure people who work can take the time they need to address serious health and caregiving needs. #FAMILYAct
Proud to join my colleagues as a co-sponsor of the Family And Medical Insurance Leave Act, which would create a strong and inclusive national family and medical leave insurance program. #FAMILYAct

The Social Media Use in Clearance Investigations Act, H.R. 1065, will
also allow more efficient adoption of evolving technologies. Sincere thanks to Chairman Elijah Cummings (D-MD) for his great support. @RepCummings

The enhanced national security clearance process provided in my Bill, H.R. 1065, will better protect government workers, federal facilities and sensitive government information from malign individuals who may seek to threaten our National Security.
Very thankful for the support of my House colleagues today in passing my Bill, the Social Media Use in Clearance Investigations Act, which now heads to the Senate.

I have heard firsthand from my constituents how debilitating airplane noise can be for those who live under flight paths, and the Air Traffic Noise and Pollution Expert Consensus Act is a first step to addressing this widespread problem. https://www.congress.gov/bill/116th-congress/house-bill/976/text?q=%7B%22search%22%3A%22Air+Traffic+Noise+and+Pollution%22%7D …

Glad to see my Bill, H.R. 976, the Air Traffic Noise and Pollution Expert Consensus Act, was introduced in the House yesterday, which will require the FAA to sponsor an Expert Consensus Report on the health effects of airplanes flying over residential areas.
